00033 # Description: To verify that the device correctly sends reset segments 
00034 #              while in a non sync state 
00035 #

00038 import unittest 
00039 from pcs.packets import ipv4
00040 from pcs.packets import tcp
00041 from pcs.packets import ethernet
00042 import tcptest
00043 import pcs
00044 import pdb, time, random
00045 
00046 class TestResetFromNonSyncState(unittest.TestCase):
00047     """
00048        RFC 793 - Section 3.4 Establishing a Connection
00049        Page 36 - Reset Generation  
00050 
00051        2.  If the connection is in any non-synchronized state (LISTEN,
00052        SYN-SENT, SYN-RECEIVED), and the incoming segment acknowledges
00053        something not yet sent (the segment carries an unacceptable ACK), or
00054        if an incoming segment has a security level or compartment which
00055        does not exactly match the level and compartment requested for the
00056        connection, a reset is sent.
00057     
00058        [PREPARATION]
00059        ==at DEVICE UNDER TEST(DUT)
00060          inetd with descard server running (port 9)
00061 
00062     """
00063 
00064     def resetTcb(self, tcb):
00065 
00066         tcb.ip = { self.thisside : pcs.inet_atol("10.211.55.210") , \
00067                     self.thatside : pcs.inet_atol("10.211.55.220")}
00068        
00069        
00070         tcb.ipid = { self.thisside : random.randrange(1, (1<<16)-1) , \
00071                       self.thatside : 0}
00072        
00073        
00074         tcb.tcpport = { self.thisside : random.randrange(50000, 60000) , \
00075                          self.thatside : 9}
00076        
00077         tcb.tcpsequence = { self.thisside : random.randrange(1,(1<<32)-1),\
00078                              self.thatside : 0}
00079        
00080          
00081         tcb.ether = \
00082                 { self.thisside : ethernet.ether_atob("00:1c:42:9d:57:c9") , \
00083                   self.thatside : ethernet.ether_atob("00:1c:42:db:c5:22") }
00084     
00085         
00086         tcb.output = { self.thisside : pcs.PcapConnector("ed0") , \
00087                         self.thatside : pcs.PcapConnector("ed0") }
00088 
00089 
00090     def setUp(self):
00091         """
00092         """
00093         import random
00094         
00095         #constants
00096         self.thisside = 0
00097         self.thatside = 1
00098 
00099         self.tcb = tcptest.tcb()
00100         self.resetTcb(self.tcb)
00101         
00102     def testResetFromNonSyncStateListen(self):
00103         
00104         """
00105            RFC 793 - Section 3.4 Establishing a Connection
00106            Page 36 - Reset Generation  
00107     
00108            2.  If the connection is in any non-synchronized state (LISTEN,
00109            SYN-SENT, SYN-RECEIVED), and the incoming segment acknowledges
00110            something not yet sent (the segment carries an unacceptable ACK), or
00111            if an incoming segment has a security level or compartment which
00112            does not exactly match the level and compartment requested for the
00113            connection, a reset is sent.
00114 
00115            Sent an ACK without any other previous sent.
00116         """
00117 
00118         #Create a tcp segment with only ack bit set, and a fake ack_number 
00119         (ip, tcp) = tcptest.createoutofwindowack(self, self.tcb, self.thisside, self.thatside)
00120         tcptest.createwritepacket(self, self.tcb, ip, tcp, self.thisside, self.thatside)
00121 
00122         (iprst, tcprst) = tcptest.receive(self, self.tcb, self.thisside, self.thatside) 
00123         tcptest.assertReset(self, self.tcb, tcprst, self.thisside, self.thatside, tcp)
00124 
00125 
00126     def testResetFromNonSyncStateSynReceived(self):
00127         
00128         """
00129            RFC 793 - Section 3.4 Establishing a Connection
00130            Page 36 - Reset Generation  
00131     
00132            2.  If the connection is in any non-synchronized state (LISTEN,
00133            SYN-SENT, SYN-RECEIVED), and the incoming segment acknowledges
00134            something not yet sent (the segment carries an unacceptable ACK), or
00135            if an incoming segment has a security level or compartment which
00136            does not exactly match the level and compartment requested for the
00137            connection, a reset is sent.
00138 
00139            Sent an ACK without any other previous sent.
00140         """
00141 
00142         self.resetTcb( self.tcb )
00143         
00144         (ipsyn, tcpsyn) = tcptest.createsyn(self, self.tcb, self.thisside, self.thatside)
00145         tcptest.createwritepacket(self, self.tcb, ipsyn, tcpsyn, self.thisside, self.thatside)   
00146         
00147         (ipsynack, tcpsynack) = tcptest.receive(self, self.tcb, self.thisside, self.thatside)
00148 
00149         #Create a tcp segment with only ack bit set, and a fake ack_number 
00150         (ip, tcp) = tcptest.createoutofwindowack(self, self.tcb, self.thisside, self.thatside)
00151         tcptest.createwritepacket(self, self.tcb, ip, tcp, self.thisside, self.thatside)
00152            
00153         (iprst, tcprst) = tcptest.receive(self, self.tcb, self.thisside, self.thatside) 
00154         tcptest.assertReset(self, self.tcb, tcprst, self.thisside, self.thatside, tcp)
00155 
00156 
00157 if __name__ == '__main__':
00158     unittest.main()
